title.narrative: SYSTEM-WIDE QUALITY TEACHING AND LEARNING IN INCLUSIVE SCHOOLS

description.narrative: Teachers have the necessary skills and practices to apply leaner-centred, competency-based and inclusive education, and are supported through effective policies, monitoring and assessment, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: All children learn and develop their competencies through quality, inclusive education that fosters their wellbeing and active participation in the community

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Teachers have the necessary skills and practices to apply leaner-centred, competency-based and inclusive education, and aresupported through effective policies, monitoring and assessment

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to take a multifaceted approach to accelerating progress in the quality inclusive education agenda, with the overarching goal of ensuring equal access to education for all children, including children with disabilities and those from marginalized groups.Thirty schools received equipment and capacity building to bridge the digital divide, and support to ensure distance learning was provided, with 1,150 video lessons for TV-broadcasting having been edited, while 38,500 teachers increased their capacities to deliver online and hybrid classes. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:05/01/2022
